summary: Hey bro, I love your blog, it's awesome, and I hope Jonsa is ENDGAME but my question is do you think Sansa has feeling for Jon,...
question: Hey bro, I love your blog, it's awesome, and I hope Jonsa is ENDGAME but my question is do you think Sansa has feeling for Jon, because, for me it looks like Jon has established feelings for her but is scared to voice them or act on them, but it would be awesome if you could do what you do best and prove to j0nerys bro what we are talking about?
answer:
Hey!

Thank you so much! Sorry for the delayed response. I definitely feel like Sansa has subconscious feelings for Jon! Sansa loves Jon deeply and cares about him but I don’t think she knows the true nature of the love she has for him. When Dany arrives to Winterfell in season 8, I think that realization will hit Sansa like a ton of bricks. I think at this point they’re both confused about their relationship. In an ideal situation their relationship should be a simple brother and sister dynamic but it’s not. Their history and the circumstances they face make it anything but that and it’s “messy and complicated.”

For Jon I’ve always been on the fence about whether or not his feelings are subconscious or if he’s fully aware about how he feels about Sansa. Right now, I think he’s somewhere in between the two. I think he’s fully aware about the affect Sansa has on him but is deeply conflicted about his feelings and tries to ignore them or pass it off. The thing is Jon struggles to hide how he feels and his feelings tend to manifest in times that should make any audience raise their eyebrow. The moments that particularly stick out to me are all the encounters he’s had with Sansa’s male suitors, both battlement scenes, the tent scene and the North is Yours scene.

I think in these moments it really shows Jon not only manifesting his true feelings for Sansa but also I think it shows that Jon himself being surprised by the wave emotions he has for her and how much she truly affects hims.

Thanks for the ask.

blog.description: This is a multi-fandom blog with no real guidelines in play. I reblog whatever I wanna. Well, anything relatively clean. I try to keep this a safe space as much as possible. I may screw up once and a while, but I don't wanna make anyone's day worse by making them feel bad. Nothing too politic. I just wanna make people's day better.

summary:
tatticstudio55
 replied to your post  “still mad D&D didnt have enough time to properly expand on...”
                        I...
body:
tatticstudio55 replied to your post “still mad D&D didnt have enough time to properly expand on…”
I don’t think Sansa ever wanted (or planned for) Jon to be killed, but it would make a lot of sense if that was what Littlefinger was hoping for (that Jon would be killed, leaving only Sansa for the North)…

IDK, back in S6, it felt like that’s what D&D wanted to do. I don’t think taditional “Sansa” would have done it, but back then it felt like D&D was going for  bloody starkbowl drama in spite of her character (even if it was OOC). Her actions during BOTB didnt make any sense. she demanded jon not act and to find more men. but she refused to inform him about the knights of the vale. then she ended up bringing the vale anyway. they still havent explained why she did that shit.

but yes, that is what petyr was hoping for.

blog.name: kellyvela
blog.title: IF I CAN DREAM…
blog.description: Waiting for The Winds of Winter to read the real Jon Snow written by GRRM

summary: "Freedom of the castle"
title: "Freedom of the castle"
body:
Don’t you find this: 

JON: I’m a prisoner on this island.

TYRION: I wouldn’t say you’re a prisoner on this island. You’re free to walk the castle, the beaches, to go wherever you want.

JON: Except to my ship. They took my ship.

TYRION: I wouldn’t say we took your ship.

JON: I’m not playing word games with you. The dead are coming for us all.

—GOT S7 - E3 “The Queen’s Justice” 

Very similar to this:

Ser Mandon Moore went to take his place under the throne beside two of his fellows of the Kingsguard. Sansa hovered by the door, for once unguarded. The queen had given her freedom of the castle as a reward for being good, yet even so, she was escorted everywhere she went. “Honor guards for my daughter-to-be,” the queen called them, but they did not make Sansa feel honored.

“Freedom of the castle” meant that she could go wherever she chose within the Red Keep so long as she promised not to go beyond the walls, a promise Sansa had been more than willing to give. She couldn’t have gone beyond the walls anyway. The gates were watched day and night by Janos Slynt’s gold cloaks, and Lannister house guards were always about as well. Besides, even if she could leave the castle, where would she go? It was enough that she could walk in the yard, pick flowers in Myrcella's garden, and visit the sept to pray for her father. Sometimes she prayed in the godswood as well, since the Starks kept the old gods.

—A Game of Thrones - Sansa V

Right?

summary: ASOIAF AU - JON OF HOUSE DAYNE ❝ Instead of going to Winterfell with Ned Stark, Jon grows up in Starfall, as the bastard son of...
caption:
ASOIAF AU - JON OF HOUSE DAYNE

❝ Instead of going to Winterfell with Ned Stark, Jon grows up in Starfall, as the bastard son of the Lord Dayne. When his “father” passes away, and there is no other heir to the house, he becomes the Lord of Starfall.

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: The title king consort continues not to exist and consorts remain powerless
summary: I think Jon would be horrified when he finds out that he was intimate with his aunt.  He was influenced by the wildings who...
question: I think Jon would be horrified when he finds out that he was intimate with his aunt.  He was influenced by the wildings who really don't like incest.  And I don't believe that he knows about dany burning people.  And Jon will choose Sam over dany since he chose his brothers at the night watch over ygritte.  I don't think polical Jon happened in the show but he will definitely choose Sam over dany.
answer: I certainly hope that Jon won’t choose Dany over his family or his best friend Sam, but I have my doubts about it.  The whole groveling to Dany thing made no sense in terms of plot in Season 7 which makes me concerned about their “relationship” in Season 8.

reblog.comment: I certainly hope that Jon won’t choose Dany over his family or his best friend Sam, but I have my doubts about it.  The whole groveling to Dany thing made no sense in terms of plot in Season 7 which makes me concerned about their “relationship” in Season 8.

tags: this is just for shits and giggles
summary: According to the show-verse, Jon is Ice and Dany is Fire and Arya’s name is incredibly similar to Aria, which is another word...
body:
According to the show-verse, Jon is Ice and Dany is Fire and Arya’s name is incredibly similar to Aria, which is another word for Song. 

Arya/Jon/Dany = A Song of Ice and Fire 

guys I found the endgame everyone can go home now

summary: OK if Dany is unnaceptable person for Jon because of Tarlyes Who is Arya Stark? She killed whole house of Frey in seson 8 Freys...
caption:
OK if Dany is unnaceptable person for Jon because of Tarlyes

Who is Arya Stark?

She killed whole house of Frey in seson 8

Freys are enemy for Starks but Tarlyes were enemys for Dany too.

Jonsas want   to say that Arya is unacceptable  person  for Jon because she is a killer? 

And Sansa is a hero for Jon? Woman who gave a Ramsy to dogs?  Dogs ate   Ramsy in front of Sansa.? He was alive. she was standing and looking how dogs eating Ramsy. And Sansa it less sadistic than Dany and Arya?

OK Try again babies .

summary: Clever tricksy crows
body:
Clever tricksy crows

“Mance has cunning. He was raised a crow, you know, and the crow’s a tricksy bird.” 

    - Tormund on Mance (but Jon used guile to outsmart him), ASOS

“Maester Aemon thinks you clever.” 

    - Mormont to Jon, ACOK

“No one ever trusted Rattleshirt but fools. Snow’s not that.”

   - Mance, ADWD
